title: Bug: Inheriting Appearence settings in RDP sessions doesn't work consistently
author: koumdros
body_snippet:
<!-- Bug -->
Windows RDP connections do not always inherit apperance settings ( Display themes/ Display Desktop / etc), if they are set in folders containing said sessions.

Sometimes if I toggle the inheritance settings on/off/ backup on again, and reconnect it works but NOT in all cases.
|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|

iterations.description: Inheritance of appearance settings breaks when duplicating RDP connections, suggesting the clone/duplicate logic doesn't properly copy or link inheritance references

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: Can you please provide step by step instructions on how we can reproduce this?

comments.author: koumdros
comments.snippet:
ok, here goes.

Create a folder with said metadata defined. Then create an RDP connection and define it to use the inherited settings from the folder.

At this point it should work, and it usually does.

Now duplicate the connection ( easiest way to create a very similar connection), and give it different hostname /target etc.

at this point for me it is seemingly a toos of the ide whether the new connection will correctly inherit the settings.

notes:
AI triage: Inheritance of appearance settings breaks when duplicating RDP connections, suggesting the clone/duplicate logic doesn't properly copy or link inheritance references
Approach: Investigate the connection duplication logic to ensure inherited appearance properties (colors, fonts, wallpaper etc.) are correctly cloned with their inheritance flags preserved, rather than being reset or disconnected from the parent folder's settings
